page.title: 04BUCKS HILL HOUSE
page.content: {Bucks Hill House,}two miles east of Sarratt, is the West Hertfordshire Agricultural Management Centre, part of Watford College Management Studies Department. It was opened on October 9 1968 by John Davies, then head of the C.B.I. It is used for short courses on agricultural topics. Formerly it was a turkey farm owned by a Mrs Bell. In the grounds there used to be some stables and a shelter for coach and horses. The latter is now a garage. A giant redwood tree once stood in the grounds and could be seen from Sarratt. It was sadly struck down by lightning. There is a horsechestnut tree in the grounds which has been grafted and now produces pink AND white blossom through the spring and summer.
